Class Bitmap

public class Bitmap

Represents bitmap images.

Field Detail

width

public short width
Width of the image in pixels.

height

public short height
Height of the image in pixels.

depth

public int depth
Color depth in bytes per pixel.

pixels

public short[] pixels
Pixel data. Pixels are adviced to be stored from left to right, and top to down, all color components together if there are any. For example, three red-green-blue component pixel data would be in order RGB RGB RGB. Every short value is actually an unsigned byte, meaning its value is 0..255. That's because Java doesn't have an "unsigned byte" type.

Constructor Detail

Bitmap

public Bitmap()
Constructs new bitmap with default size of 0 x 0 pixels and depth of 3. Image data is null.

Method Detail

resize

public void resize(int newWidth,
                   int newHeight,
                   int newDepth)
Resizes the image reallocating memory for pixel data.

Parameters:
newWidth - desired width of the image.
newHeight - desired height of the image.
newDepth - desired depth of the image in bytes.
